summary: This is an email exchange within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding interest in hosting an NYU Law School intern for the fall 2019 semester. One attorney notes their workload will be mostly Epstein-related, indicating the ongoing focus on the case at that time.

persons.name: Unknown Attorney
persons.context: An attorney in the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York who responds to an email about NYU Law interns, disclosing that their fall workload will be mostly Epstein-related.

persons.name: Unknown Coordinator
persons.context: The sender of the initial email to the office attorneys, soliciting interest in working with NYU Law School interns for the fall semester and asking about trial schedules.

events.title: Fall Internship Semester Start
events.description: The planned start date for NYU Law School interns at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Fall Internship Semester End
events.description: The planned end date for the NYU Law School fall internship program at the U.S. Attorney's Office.

keyFacts: The email is dated July 29, 2019, after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest in July 2019.
An attorney in the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York states their fall 2019 workload will be 'mostly Epstein-related'.
The correspondence indicates the office was actively managing its caseload and resources, including intern assignments, in relation to the Epstein case.
The document shows internal administrative planning within the prosecution team handling the Epstein case.
